phrases: Is it that easy to adjust the Uka-no-Mitama virus?
The process itself should be pretty much automated,
so as long as the equipment still works, yes.
They chose Uka-no-Mitama precisely because of how easy it is to update.
To think that a benign virus would end up becoming an actual disease...
We thought of it as an iron shield defending our food autonomy,
but it ended up being a double-edged sword.
Go.
'The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.
But while everyone was sleeping,
his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and went away.
I would like to show
Cut open my skull
Look into my head
I do not know why I am so harsh
I cannot be so brash
I am going to crash
Because I feel
I can always show my everything to you
If this moment was for me
I try to hear, lend my ear
Voices inside, one link to join it all
Again
Because I feel
I can always show my everything to you
If this moment was for me
I try to hear, lend my ear
Voices inside, one link to join it all
So it goes
Again
21: Blood-Stained Reward
The security is still active...
Where can I find another way in...?
Oh?
Dammit!
What a huge place...
Well, this factory centrally manages the defense virus in order to distribute it to the entire Hokuriku area.
It is amazing that such a large-scale facility can continue to operate in a fully automated manner.
The bigger the prey, the easier it is to target.
Especially when you are wielding a poisoned needle strong enough to kill a whale.
This sort of tactic is just like Makishima.
It is probably from Kougami.
He must have seen us land.
In which case, he is nearby.
Tsunemori speaking.
I did not expect you to get here so soon.
Do not underestimate the Bureau's resources.
You are not the only one here capable of driving Makishima into a corner.
He is already inside the facility.
In fact, he is probably adjusting the Uka-no-Mitama virus right now using the equipment Kudama left in the lab.
Or he might even have finished already.
We are not going to let him have his way.
Then we do not have a moment to lose.
We have to shut down the entire facility before he is able to distribute the Uka-no-Mitama that he tampered with.
The Bureau has the authority to cut off the power to this facility, right?
That would halt not only its operation but its security system as well.
That is what you want, is not it?
You are trying to use us to lift the security so that you can beat us to Makishima and kill him, are not you?
We cannot let you do that.
Makishima is trying to destroy this country.
The Bureau has only one choice right now.
Cut the power.
Then this country will be saved.
I will save you too.
I will not let Kougami Shinya become a murderer.
Then let the fastest one win.
Cannot we have control of the security system transferred to us from the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry?
The process will take time.
If Makishima finishes before us, it is checkmate.
We have no choice but to stop the facility itself, like Kougami said.
Kunizuka?
I have already disabled the secondary power supply.
All we have to do now is cut off the primary power source.
There is something I would like to ask of you.
When you encounter Kougami, if the Eliminator ends up activating because his Crime Coefficient is over 300,
please do not shoot him.
Call me.
What is the point of that?
I have got a trump card up my sleeve for Kougami.
Do not worry.
Just leave it to me.
Now we will go after Makishima.
You will help us, right?
Of course.
Then I need you to lock this gun in Paralyzer mode with the safety off.
You can do that, right?
The Dominator decides its enforcement mode based on the measured Crime Coefficients.
This is the foundation of the system that maintains public safety.
It cannot be changed.
If we are to fight Makishima, we need weapons that can do the job.
We have to protect ourselves too, after all.
If we cannot use the Dominators, we will have no choice but to depend on more primitive weapons.
If worst comes to worst, we may end up killing Makishima with those weapons.
Your lack of resourcefulness would be at fault in that scenario, not us.
Our abilities are limited and the probability that we will capture Makishima alive without problems is hardly 100.
If you are able to grant an exception here,
we may be able to improve that chance a little.
Think about which course of action offers the most benefit.
You are good at calculating risk and reward, right?
From now until Makishima Shougo is captured,
we will grant an exception on the applicable terminal device.
The safety will remain off.
Mode is Non-Lethal Paralyzer.
However, please pay close attention to how you use it to ensure the other detectives do not find out.
I know.
Say, young lady.
You have been acting strange ever since the Chief called you out.
I do not know what happened, but are you sure you can shoulder that burden alone?
Are you worried about me?
Yeah, you are acting the same as Kougami did.
I do not want to see you push yourself too hard as an Inspector and burn out.
Then would you like to check my Crime Coefficient?
Hey, hey...
It is okay.
Please point the Dominator at me.
I will delete the record using my authority as an Inspector.
Crime Coefficient is 24.
An Inspector registered at the Criminal Investigation Department.
See?
Right now, I am someone the System wants.
Yeah...
Kunizuka, please go ahead.
Okay.
I will cut off the power to the entire facility.
Not bad, Bureau.
Here goes!
Either way, Makishima's attempt at bio-terrorism ends here.
Would not the rational thing be to escape immediately?
I am not so sure about that.
True, Makishima has carefully considered his actions up to this point,
but that does not necessarily mean he acts purely on logic.
Are you saying that he will stick to his plan even now?
If there is any way he can succeed, yes.
What about the emergency power supply?
Right now, we are just blocking his use of it from outside, are not we?
Yeah.
That means it can still be manually rebooted via the control board inside the facility.
That is his only chance for getting the power back.
Should we wait for him at the central control room, then?
Wait.
We cannot rule out the possibility that he will simply try to escape.
There is no time for us to make a detour.
Let us split in two.
I will go to the control room.
Inspector Ginoza, please check the university's lab.
I will go with Inspector Tsunemori.
If we work with Shion at Headquarters via the main security console,
we might be able to get access to the security cameras here.
Then we will be in charge of chasing him down, huh?
Come on, do not make that face.
It is our job as men to take on the dirty work.
Dammit!
Did something happen at the Ministry of Welfare?
Does it seem that way?
You look like you could take on the world right now, but at the same time,
you look like that whole world's weighing on your shoulders.
Giving up here would not resolve anything.
I just have to press forward.
No matter how small it may be, there is still hope.
As long as I do not give up on it,
I can continue to be a detective until the end.
When you joined us as a new Inspector,
my first impression was that you were a naIve little girl who could not possibly be fit for the job.
Yeah, I guess I was.
But in fact, I have never been further from the truth.
I am sure of that now.
I would trust you with my life, Inspector Tsunemori.
You think too highly of me.
Clear.
I guess we made it in time...
But do you think Makishima will really come this way?
That is right...
Why is not there anyone here?
What?
There is someone who can foresee Makishima's
actions more accurately than me.
If we were right, I would expect to see Kougami here already.
Why...?
There must be something we are overlooking.
There is something I need to ask you.
Here and now?
What is on your mind?
You helped Kougami escape, did not you?
I am an old man, you know?
Cut me some slack.
You think that it is okay for Kougami to take the law into his own hands, as long as evil is defeated as a result.
That is the savage, selfish idea of justice shared by old-fashioned hunting dogs like yourself.
Am I wrong?
Kougami is the one you are relying on to get the job done.
You do not expect anything from me.
You think there is no chance in hell I can capture Makishima, do not you?
Kogami is a latent criminal as well as an Enforcer.
He and I are cut from the same cloth.
But you are still on a different path than we are.
I truly do think that is for the best.
From the bottom of my heart.
What kind of justification is that?
A culprit runs, and detectives go after him...
That is what we assumed would happen.
Inspector?
But Makishima looks at things differently than we do.
He understands just how much of a bind we are in,
better than we do ourselves.
Ginoza and Masaoka are in danger!
Please wait!
It is dangerous to go by yourself!
You stay here.
If Makishima comes, whatever you do, do not let him touch the emergency power supply!
Destroy the whole console if you need to!
Ginoza! Inspector Ginoza?!
Wait!
Nobuchika!
Dammit!
Hold on!
Behind you!
You bastard!
What?
Are you trying to blow us both up?
You think I would do something stupid like that?
Do not let that man go!
You must stop him at any cost, Enforcer!
You are a detective!
Fulfill your duty!
Pops...!
You...
You idiot!
Why did you let the culprit get away?!
Why?!
You are a detective, are not you?!
I am not fit to be called a detective.
You are my son, after all.
Your eyes... look just the same as mine did...
when I was your age.
Dad...
Dad!
Why?!
Why?
It is too late!
So you finally ditched that fake justice and developed some real bloodlust, huh?
You are everything I hoped you would be after all.
That so?
Sorry, but I never had any hopes for you to begin with.
Do not act so indifferent after coming this far for me.
Cut the arrogance.
There is nothing exceptional about you.
You are just a piece of garbage, forsaken by society.
I bet you feel bitter after being rejected by your peers and excluded from the community, do not you?
You just cannot stand to be on your own!
You are no different from a kid whining about not wanting to be left out.
You sure do say some funny things.
Do you think I am the only one who is left out?
Who is not alone in this society?
The time when our connection to others was the basis of our selves is long gone.
There is no place for communities in this world
where everyone is watched over by the system and lives within the system's standards.
Everyone stays in their own little cell,
and the system tames them by giving them each their own personal serenity.
There is no way I could love anyone,
There is no way I could love anyone,
but I wish to be loved by someone in turn
but I wish to be loved by someone in turn
The world may not have
The world may not have
ended yesterday after all,
ended yesterday after all,
but we will not budge
but we will not budge
from where we are
from where we are
God, in favor of which parts have you left us?
God, in favor of which parts have you left us?
I receive no reply
I receive no reply
I never do
I never do
Are you still here?
Are you still here?
You will never walk alone
You will never walk alone
I walk with you
I walk with you
I will share all your sins
I will share all your sins
Together with you
Together with you
I walk
I walk
a trackless path
a trackless path
This is a world where the mental state and personal tendencies of humans can be quantified.
While all sorts of inclinations are recorded and policed, these measured numbers used to judge people's souls are commonly called Psycho-Pass.
This is a world where the mental state and personal tendencies of humans can be quantified.
While all sorts of inclinations are recorded and policed, these measured numbers used to judge people's souls are commonly called Psycho-Pass.
This story is a work of fiction.
The names of all individuals and organizations that appear in this show are fictitious and any similarity to those in existence in the real world is purely coincidental.
